rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Speed Control
Exceeding the speed limit is a common contributing factor of fatal and other types of crashes. A motorist must always obey the speed limit. Speed affects almost everything that can happen when driving. A good rule is to keep up with the flow of traffic at any legal speed. To make safe emergency stops when necessary, it is important to keep enough distance from surrounding traffic. New Jersey law sets top speed limits for any given road, street, highway, or freeway.
SPEED LIMIT 25 mph: School zones, business, or residential districts
SPEED LIMIT 35 mph: Suburban business and residential districts
SPEED LIMIT 50 mph: Non-posted rural roadways
SPEED LIMIT 55 mph: Certain state highways (as posted) and interstates
SPEED LIMIT 65 mph: Certain interstate highways (as posted)
Motorists pay double fines for exceeding the 65 mph limit by 10 miles per hour or more. Double fines also apply to most other moving violations committed in a 65 mph zone. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-98.6)
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
速度控制  
超速是导致致命和其他类型交通事故的常见原因之一。驾驶员必须始终遵守速度限制。速度影响着驾驶过程中几乎所有可能发生的情况。一个良好的驾驶原则是，在任何合法速度范围内，保持与交通流一致。为在必要时安全地紧急停车，保持与周围车辆的安全距离非常重要。新泽西州法律对任何道路、街道、公路或高速公路设定了最高限速。

**限速 25 英里/小时**：学校区域、商业区或居民区  
**限速 35 英里/小时**：郊区商业区和居民区  
**限速 50 英里/小时**：未标明限速的乡村道路  
**限速 55 英里/小时**：某些州际公路（如标明）和高速公路  
**限速 65 英里/小时**：某些州际公路（如标明）

驾驶员若在限速 65 英里/小时的区域超速 10 英里/小时或以上，将面临双倍罚款。双倍罚款也适用于大多数其他在 65 英里/小时区域发生的移动违规行为。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-98.6）
trl:
rule 1
IF location = 学校区域 OR location = 商业区 OR location = 居民区 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 25 mph

rule 2
IF location = 郊区商业区 OR location = 郊区居民区 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 35 mph

rule 3
IF location = 乡村道路 AND condition = 未标明限速 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 50 mph

rule 4
IF location = 某些州际公路 OR location = 高速公路 AND condition = 标明55英里/小时 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 55 mph

rule 5
IF location = 某些州际公路 AND condition = 标明65英里/小时 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 65 mph

rule 6
IF location = 限速65英里/小时区域 AND speed > 75 mph AND action = 行驶
THEN outcome = 双倍罚款

rule 7
IF location = 限速65英里/小时区域 AND event = 发生移动违规行为 AND condition = 大多数类型
THEN outcome = 双倍罚款

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
NEW JERSEY LIMITS (UNLESS OTHERWISE POSTED) (N.J.S.A. 39:4-98)
Never drive faster than weather, road, or other conditions safely allow, regardless of the posted speed limit. A motorist should judge his/her speed control by existing conditions. A motorist should slow down enough to be able to see clearly and stop quickly in traffic. Failure to do so can result in a moving violation.
Always slow down:
• On narrow or winding roads.
• At intersections or railroad crossings.
• On hills.
• At sharp or blind curves.
• Where there are pedestrians or driving hazards.
• When the road is wet or slippery.
If vehicle problems prevent a motorist from keeping up with the normal flow of traffic, he/she should pull off the road and activate hazard lights.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
新泽西州限速规定（除非另有标明）（N.J.S.A. 39:4-98）  
不得以超过天气、道路或其他条件安全允许的速度驾驶，无论标示的限速是多少。驾驶员应根据现有条件判断自己的行驶速度。驾驶员应减速至足以在交通中清晰看到并迅速停车的程度。未能做到这一点可能导致移动违规。  

始终减速：  
• 在狭窄或弯曲道路上。  
• 在交叉路口或铁路道口。  
• 在坡道上。  
• 在急转弯或视距受阻的弯道处。  
• 在有行人或驾驶危险的地方。  
• 在道路湿滑或结冰时。  

如果车辆出现问题导致驾驶员无法跟上正常交通流，应将车辆驶离道路并开启危险警示灯。

THEN speed <= 安全允许的速度

rule 2

THEN action = 减速

THEN action = 减速

rule 6

THEN action = 减速

rule 7
IF condition = 道路湿滑 OR condition = 道路结冰 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 减速

rule 8
IF event = 车辆出现问题 AND condition = 无法跟上正常交通流
THEN action = 将车辆驶离道路 AND action = 开启危险警示灯

rule:
DRIVING TOO SLOWLY
A motorist should always try to keep up with the normal flow of traffic, while not exceeding the posted speed limit. Some crashes are caused by driving too slowly and backing up traffic. When road surfaces and traffic are normal, New Jersey law prohibits blocking traffic through slow driving. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-56)
rule_cn:
**驾驶速度过慢**

驾驶员应始终努力与正常的交通流量保持一致，同时不得超过规定的限速。有些事故是由于驾驶速度过慢并造成交通滞缓而引发的。当道路状况和交通正常时，新泽西州法律禁止通过缓慢驾驶来阻碍交通。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-56）
trl:
rule 1
IF condition = 道路状况正常 AND condition = 交通正常 AND action = 缓慢驾驶 AND event = 阻碍交通
THEN outcome = 禁止
rule 2
IF action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 规定限速 AND speed = 与正常交通流量一致
trl_postprocess:

then 结果 = 禁止
rule 2
if 操作 = 行驶
then 速度 <= 规定限速 and 速度 = 与正常交通流量一致

rule:
SAFE CORRIDORS (N.J.S.A. 39:4-203.5)
To improve highway safety, New Jersey initiated the Safe Corridors Program, which was signed into law in July 2003. The Safe Corridors law doubles fines on various state highways for a variety of driving offenses, including speeding and aggressive driving. Highways are designated as safe corridors based on statistics showing crash rates 50 percent over the state rate and 1,000 or more crashes reported over a three-year period. The Commissioner of Transportation has the authority to designate safe corridors as necessary, as well as to remove those that show improved safety levels. A current list of Safe Corridor highways is available on the New Jersey Department of Transportation website at www.nj.gov/transportation.
rule_cn:
安全走廊（新泽西州法律第39:4-203.5条）  
为提高公路安全，新泽西州于2003年7月颁布了《安全走廊计划》。该法律对多种州内公路的交通违规行为，如超速和危险驾驶等，实施罚款加倍的措施。公路被指定为安全走廊，是基于统计数据，即事故率比全州平均水平高出50%，并在三年内报告了1000起或以上的事故。运输部长有权根据需要指定安全走廊，并在安全水平有所改善时将其移除。目前安全走廊公路的清单可在新泽西州运输部网站www.nj.gov/transportation上查询。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Passing
A motorist must know the proper lane for normal driving and how to change lanes safely. The rules for passing depend on the type of road. Stay to the right of the roadway’s center lines. Passing is only safe when there is no oncoming traffic.
Watch for the following lane markings: (N.J.S.A. 39:4-86)
• Both center lines are solid: No passing allowed.
• One center line is broken: Passing is allowed only on the side with the broken line.
• Both center lines are broken: Passing is allowed on both sides.
Note: All passing must be completed before the center lines are solid again.
PASS ONLY WHEN SAFE: When line is broken PASS; DO NOT PASS When line is solid; NO PASSING With double solid lines
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
超车  
驾驶员必须了解正常驾驶时应使用的正确车道以及如何安全地变换车道。超车规则取决于道路类型。应保持在道路中心线的右侧。只有在没有对向来车时，超车才是安全的。  

请注意以下车道标线：（新泽西州法律第39:4-86条）  
• 两条中心线均为实线：禁止超车。  
• 一条中心线为虚线：仅允许在虚线一侧超车。  
• 两条中心线均为虚线：两侧均可超车。  

注意：所有超车操作必须在中心线重新变为实线之前完成。  

**仅在安全时超车**：当标线为虚线时可超车；当标线为实线时禁止超车；双实线标线时禁止超车。
trl:
rule 1
IF condition = 两条中心线均为实线 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule 2
IF condition = 一条中心线为虚线 AND action = 超车 AND location = 虚线一侧
THEN outcome = 允许超车

rule 3
IF condition = 一条中心线为虚线 AND action = 超车 AND location = 实线一侧
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule 4
IF condition = 两条中心线均为虚线 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 允许超车

rule 5
IF condition = 中心线为实线 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule 6
IF condition = 双实线标线 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule 7
IF action = 超车 AND event = 中心线重新变为实线之前未完成
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule 8
IF action = 超车 AND condition = 标线为虚线 AND condition = 安全
THEN outcome = 允许超车

rule 9
IF action = 超车 AND condition = 标线为实线
THEN outcome = 禁止超车

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Most passing should be on the left. Passing on the right is allowed only on roads with more than one lane going in the same direction, if vehicles on the roadway are moving in two or more substantially continuous lines or when the motorist ahead is making a left turn and there is room to pass. Never pass on the right shoulder of the road. This is against the law. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-85)
A motorist should not pass:
• On a hill or curve or at any time he/she cannot see far enough ahead.
• At a street crossing or intersection.
• At a railroad crossing.
• On narrow bridges or in underpasses or tunnels.
• When a sign prohibits passing or center lines restrict passing.
• When behind a vehicle that has stopped to let a pedestrian cross.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
大多数超车应从左侧进行。只有在同方向设有两条或以上车道、道路上车辆以两个或多个连续的车道行驶，或者前方驾驶员正在左转且有足够空间超车时，才允许从右侧超车。禁止从道路右侧路肩超车，这是违法行为。（新泽西州法律第39:4-85条）  

驾驶员不得在以下情况下超车：  
• 在坡道、弯道或视线受阻、无法看清前方足够距离的地方。  
• 在街道交叉口或路口处。  
• 在铁路道口处。  
• 在狭窄的桥梁、地下通道或隧道内。  
• 当有禁止超车的标志或中心线限制超车时。  
• 在跟随一辆停车让行人通过的车辆后方。
trl:
rule 1
IF action = 超车
THEN direction = 左侧

rule 2
IF condition = 同方向设有两条或以上车道 OR condition = 道路上车辆以两个或多个连续的车道行驶 OR (event = 前方驾驶员正在左转 AND condition = 有足够空间超车)
THEN direction = 右侧 允许

rule 3
IF direction = 右侧路肩 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 违法

rule 4
IF (location = 坡道 OR location = 弯道 OR condition = 视线受阻 OR condition = 无法看清前方足够距离) AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule 5
IF location = 街道交叉口 OR location = 路口 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule 6
IF location = 铁路道口 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule 7
IF location = 狭窄的桥梁 OR location = 地下通道 OR location = 隧道 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule 8
IF condition = 有禁止超车的标志 OR condition = 中心线限制超车 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule 9
IF event = 跟随一辆停车让行人通过的车辆 AND action = 超车
THEN outcome = 禁止

rule:
Keeping to the Right
New Jersey law requires motorists to keep to the right, except when passing. Motorists must drive on the right half of the roadway unless driving on a one-way street. Motorists must drive a vehicle as close as possible to the right-hand edge or curb of the roadway, except when overtaking and passing another vehicle. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-82)
On a multi-lane roadway, motorists must drive in the lane nearest to the right-hand edge or curb of the roadway when the lane is available for travel, except when overtaking another vehicle or in preparation for a left turn. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-88)
rule_cn:
靠右行驶

新泽西州法律规定，机动车驾驶员必须靠右行驶，除非在超车时。机动车驾驶员除非在单行道上行驶，否则必须在道路的右半部分行驶。机动车驾驶员应尽可能靠近道路右侧边缘或路缘行驶，除非在超车和超越其他车辆时。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-82）

在有多车道的道路，如果车道可供行驶，驾驶员必须在靠近道路右侧边缘或路缘的车道内行驶，除非在超车或准备左转时。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-88）

rule:
Yielding the Right-of-Way
Although laws govern the right-of-way, a motorist should always be prepared to yield. These basic rules always apply:
• Emergency vehicles: When police cars, fire engines, and ambulances are giving warning signs (sirens, flashing lights).
• Trains: When a train is approaching a railroad crossing.
• Buses: When re-entering the flow of traffic.
• Postal vehicles: When the vehicle re-enters the flow of traffic.
• Motorized or mobility-assistance devices: When in a crosswalk or seeking to cross a road.
• Other vehicles: That are already in the intersection.
rule_cn:
让行规则

虽然法律规范了让行规则，但驾驶员应始终做好让行准备。以下基本规则始终适用：

• 应急车辆：当警车、消防车和救护车发出警示信号（警报器、闪烁灯光）时。

• 火车：当火车接近铁路道口时。

• 公交车：当公交车重新进入车流时。

• 邮政车辆：当邮政车辆重新进入车流时。

• 机动车辆或助行设备：当在人行横道上或试图横穿道路时。

• 其他车辆：已经在路口内的车辆。

THEN action = 让行 AND target = 应急车辆

rule 2

rule 3

THEN action = 让行 AND target = 机动车辆或助行设备

rule 6
IF event = 其他车辆已经在路口内 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 让行 AND target = 其他车辆

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Pedestrians in a Crosswalk
New Jersey has experienced many pedestrian injury crashes and fatalities, as compared to the nation as a whole. The most important pedestrian safety message for New Jersey residents is: Pedestrian safety is a shared responsibility. There is no single cause of crashes involving pedestrians. Pedestrians and motorists must all do their part to keep pedestrians safe.
A motorist must:
• Stop for pedestrians in crosswalks. Failure to stop carries a fine of up to $500, up to 25 days in jail, community service, a driving privilege suspension of up to 6 months, and 2 points. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-36)
• Watch for pedestrians when turning on red.
• Obey speed limits.
• Be sure not to block or park in crosswalks.
• Keep the vehicle’s windshield clean for maximum visibility.
• Always be alert for pedestrians.
• Be aware of areas where pedestrians are most likely to appear (near schools, town centers, residential neighborhoods, parks).
• Never pass another vehicle that has stopped for a pedestrian.
• Stop for all pedestrians in a crosswalk even if they began crossing with a proper signal and they are still in the crosswalk when the signal changes.
• Remember that pedestrians are the most vulnerable roadway users.
Motorists will be held responsible for maintaining pedestrian safety.
rule_cn:
**安全驾驶规则与规定**  
**人行横道上的行人**

与全国平均水平相比，新泽西州经历了许多行人受伤事故和死亡事件。对于新泽西州居民来说，最重要的行人安全信息是：行人安全是所有人的共同责任。涉及行人的交通事故并非由单一原因引起。行人和驾驶员都必须尽自己的一份力量，以确保行人的安全。

驾驶员必须做到以下几点：

- **在人行横道上为行人停车**。未停车将面临最高500美元的罚款、最多25天的监禁、社区服务、最多6个月的驾驶执照暂停以及2个违规记分。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-36）  
- **在红灯转弯时注意行人**。  
- **遵守限速规定**。  
- **确保不要阻挡或在人行横道上停车**。  
- **保持挡风玻璃清洁，以确保最大能见度**。  
- **始终留意行人**。  
- **注意行人最可能出现的区域（如学校附近、城镇中心、住宅区、公园等）**。  
- **不得超车正在为行人停车的车辆**。  
- **即使行人开始过马路时有绿灯信号，且在信号灯变红时仍在人行横道上，也必须为行人停车**。  
- **记住行人是最脆弱的交通参与者**。

驾驶员将对维护行人安全负有责任。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Intersections
An intersection is where two or more roads cross or merge at angles. As most crashes occur at intersections, a motorist should be aware of the four types of intersections and know how to safely navigate through them. A single solid white line across a road at an intersection means that a motorist must stop behind the line for a traffic signal or sign.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
交叉路口  
交叉路口是指两条或更多道路以一定角度交叉或合并的地方。由于大多数交通事故都发生在交叉路口，驾驶员应了解四种类型的交叉路口，并知道如何安全地通过它们。在交叉路口，道路上的一条单实线表示驾驶员必须在该线后方停车，等待交通信号或标志。

rule 3

THEN action = 遵守交通信号或标志

rule:
CONTROLLED
An intersection is controlled if there are traffic signals or signs in any direction or controlled by a police officer. A motorist must obey the signals and signs. At a controlled intersection, a motorist must yield for certain conditions. At a multi-way stop or stop intersection, a motorist must yield to the motorist on the right if both motorists get there at the same time. A motorist should also yield to another motorist already stopped at the intersection. At an intersection controlled by a yield sign, a motorist must slow down and yield to traffic on the intersecting roadway, even if he/she must stop. When making a left turn at an intersection, a motorist must yield to oncoming traffic and stop for pedestrians within the crosswalk.
A motorist is prohibited from entering or crossing an intersecting street marked with a stop sign unless he or she first brings the vehicle to a complete stop at a point within five feet of the nearest crosswalk or stop line marked upon the pavement at the near side of the intersection street. The motorist may only proceed after yielding the right-of-way to all traffic on the intersection street, which is so close as to constitute an immediate hazard.
Note: Driving on private property to avoid a traffic signal or sign is a motor vehicle violation. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-66.2)
rule_cn:
**受控交叉路口**  
如果交叉路口的任一方向设有交通信号灯或标志，或由交警指挥，则该交叉路口为受控交叉路口。驾驶员必须遵守交通信号和标志。在受控交叉路口，驾驶员必须在某些情况下让行。在多向停车交叉路口或停车交叉路口，如果两名驾驶员同时到达，则应让行右侧的驾驶员。驾驶员还应让行已在交叉路口停车的其他车辆。在设有让行标志的交叉路口，驾驶员必须减速并让行相交道路上的车辆，即使必须停车也必须让行。在交叉路口左转时，驾驶员必须让行对向来车，并在人行横道内停车让行行人。

驾驶员不得在设有停车标志的相交道路上进入或穿越道路，除非其首先将车辆完全停在靠近交叉路口近侧道路的最近人行横道或停车线五英尺以内的位置。驾驶员只有在让行了交叉路口上所有构成即刻危险的车辆后，才能继续通行。

**注意：** 为避免交通信号或标志而驶入私人财产，属于机动车违规行为。（新泽西州法律第39:4-66.2条）
trl:
rule 1
IF location = 交叉路口 AND (condition = 任一方向设有交通信号灯 OR condition = 任一方向设有标志 OR condition = 由交警指挥)
THEN location = 受控交叉路口 AND action = 遵守 AND target = 交通信号和标志

rule 2
IF location = 受控交叉路口 AND condition = 多向停车交叉路口 OR condition = 停车交叉路口 AND event = 两名驾驶员同时到达
THEN action = 让行 AND target = 右侧驾驶员

rule 3
IF location = 受控交叉路口 AND event = 其他车辆已在交叉路口停车
THEN action = 让行 AND target = 已停车的其他车辆

rule 4
IF location = 交叉路口 AND condition = 设有让行标志
THEN action = 减速 AND action = 让行 AND target = 相交道路上的车辆 AND action = 必要时停车让行

rule 5
IF action = 左转 AND location = 交叉路口
THEN action = 让行 AND target = 对向来车 AND action = 在人行横道内停车让行 AND target = 行人

rule 6
IF condition = 设有停车标志 AND action = 进入相交道路 OR action = 穿越相交道路

THEN outcome = 机动车违规行为

rule:
UNCONTROLLED
An intersection is uncontrolled when two or more roads join and there is no traffic signal or regulatory device. A motorist must be careful when approaching these types of intersections. Most of the time there will be a warning sign prior to reaching the intersection. As a motorist nears a crossroad that is not controlled, he/she must reduce speed and be ready to stop if any traffic is coming from the right or left. A motorist coming from a private road or driveway must yield to all traffic on the main road. As a rule, the vehicle on the left should yield to the vehicle on the right. When a traffic signal is not illuminated because of a power failure or other malfunction; the traffic signal is observed as a 4-way stop signal. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-81)
rule_cn:
无信号控制
当两条或更多道路交汇且没有交通信号灯或其他交通控制装置时，该交叉路口即为无信号控制路口。驾驶员在接近此类路口时必须格外小心。通常在接近无信号控制路口之前会有警告标志。当驾驶员接近一个无信号控制的交叉路口时，应减速并准备停车，以防有车辆从右侧或左侧驶来。从私人道路或车道驶来的驾驶员必须让行所有主干道上的车辆。通常情况下，左侧车辆应让行右侧车辆。当交通信号灯因停电或其他故障而无法正常工作时，应将其视为四向停车信号。（新泽西州法律第39:4-81条）

THEN action = 停车让行

THEN action = 让行 AND target = 主干道上所有车辆

rule 5

THEN actor = 左侧车辆 AND action = 让行 AND target = 右侧车辆

rule 6
IF event = 交通信号灯故障 OR event = 停电 AND condition = 信号灯无法正常工作
THEN condition = 视为四向停车信号 AND action = 停车

rule:
BLIND LINE OF SIGHT
Buildings, parked vehicles, or bushes may obstruct a motorist’s line of sight. On rural roadways, trees or crops may obstruct a motorist’s line of sight. A motorist should always slow down or stop completely to make sure there is no cross traffic before proceeding.
rule_cn:
盲区视线

建筑物、停放的车辆或灌木可能阻挡驾驶员的视线。在乡村道路上，树木或庄稼也可能阻挡驾驶员的视线。驾驶员应始终减速或完全停车，确保没有横穿的车辆后再继续行驶。

rule:
TRAFFIC CIRCLE
There are no set rules for driving into, around and out of a traffic circle in New Jersey. Common sense and caution must always prevail. In most cases, the circle’s historically established traffic flow pattern dictates who has the right-of-way. If a major highway flows into and through the circle, it usually dominates the traffic flow pattern and commands the right-of-way. Traffic control signs, such as stop or yield signs, at the entrances to the circle also govern which motorist has the right-of-way. Never enter a traffic circle without checking all signs and determining the intentions of the motorists already moving within the circle.
Whenever a motorist is in doubt concerning who has the right-of-way in a circle, he/she should exercise extreme caution and remember the basic rule governing any uncontrolled intersection: The vehicle to the left yields the right-of-way to the vehicle approaching from the right.
rule_cn:
环岛

新泽西州对于进入、绕行以及驶出环岛的驾驶规则没有明确的规定。在这种情况下，常识和谨慎驾驶始终是最重要的。在大多数情况下，环岛历史上形成的交通流向模式决定了谁拥有优先通行权。如果一条主干道进入并穿过环岛，通常它会主导交通流向并拥有优先通行权。此外，环岛入口处的交通控制标志（如停车标志或让行标志）也决定了哪位驾驶员拥有优先通行权。在进入环岛之前，驾驶员应检查所有标志，并确定已经在环岛内行驶的驾驶员的意图。

当驾驶员对环岛中谁拥有优先通行权存在疑问时，应采取极端谨慎的态度，并记住在任何无信号控制交叉路口的基本规则：左侧车辆应让右侧车辆优先通行。

rule 1
IF location = 环岛 AND action = 进入环岛
THEN action = 检查所有交通控制标志 AND action = 确定已在环岛内车辆意图

rule 2
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 主干道进入并穿过环岛
THEN actor = 主干道进入车辆 AND outcome = 拥有优先通行权

rule 3
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 入口处有停车标志
THEN actor = 进入车辆 AND action = 停车 AND outcome = 无优先通行权

rule 4
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 入口处让行标志
THEN actor = 进入车辆 AND action = 让行 AND outcome = 无优先通行权

rule 5
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 已进入并在环岛内行驶
THEN outcome = 拥有优先通行权

rule 6
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 无信号控制 AND condition = 对优先通行权存在疑问
THEN action = 采取极端谨慎 AND actor = 左侧车辆 AND action = 让行 AND actor = 右侧车辆 AND outcome = 拥有优先通行权

rule 7
IF location = 环岛 AND condition = 对优先通行权存在疑问
THEN action = 采取极端谨慎 AND action = 谨慎驾驶

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Entering Highways, Parkways, and Turnpikes
Highways, parkways, and turnpikes are high-speed (up to 65 mph) divided roadways and generally have multiple lanes. Traffic on each side of the divide will travel in only one direction. There are no direct intersections. Motorists enter these roadways by way of acceleration lanes, which are extra lanes at highway entrances used by motorists to speed up to join the flow of traffic. A motorist must yield to traffic already traveling on the main road before moving into the proper lane.
Keep the following points in mind when entering a highway, parkway, or turnpike:
• Obey posted advisory speed limits (if any) at the entrance ramp.
• Speed up to the flow of traffic when leaving the acceleration lane.
• Avoid coming to a complete stop in the acceleration lane.
• Yield to traffic and enter the right-hand lane when safe.
• Use turn signal.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
进入高速公路、公园大道和收费公路  
高速公路、公园大道和收费公路是高速（最高可达每小时65英里）的分隔式道路，通常设有多个车道。分隔带两侧的交通均只允许单向行驶，没有直接的交叉路口。驾驶员通过加速车道进入这些道路，加速车道是位于高速公路入口处的额外车道，供驾驶员加速以融入主路车流。驾驶员在进入正确车道前，必须让行已行驶在主路上的车辆。  

在进入高速公路、公园大道或收费公路时，请牢记以下几点：  
• 遵守入口匝道上标示的建议限速（如有）。  
• 离开加速车道时，加速以融入车流。  
• 避免在加速车道完全停车。  
• 在安全的情况下让行车辆，并进入右侧车道。  
• 使用转向灯。
trl:
rule 1
IF location = 入口匝道 AND action = 进入高速公路 OR action = 进入公园大道 OR action = 进入收费公路 AND condition = 标示建议限速
THEN speed <= 建议限速

rule 2
IF action = 离开加速车道 AND event = 融入车流
THEN action = 加速

rule 3
IF location = 加速车道
THEN NOT action = 完全停车

rule 4
IF action = 进入高速公路 OR action = 进入公园大道 OR action = 进入收费公路 AND target = 主路车辆
THEN action = 让行

rule 5
IF action = 进入高速公路 OR action = 进入公园大道 OR action = 进入收费公路 AND condition = 安全
THEN target = 右侧车道 AND action = 进入

rule 6
IF action = 进入高速公路 OR action = 进入公园大道 OR action = 进入收费公路
THEN action = 使用转向灯

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Leaving Highways, Parkways, and Turnpikes
In most cases, exit ramps or deceleration lanes, which are extra lanes at a highway exit, are located on the right-hand side of the roadway. A motorist should always watch for signs that direct where to exit the roadway. If a motorist misses an exit ramp on a highway, parkway, or turnpike, he/she should go to the next exit.
Keep the following points in mind when leaving a highway, parkway, or turnpike:
• Start slowing down when entering a deceleration lane.
• Obey the posted advisory speed limit of the deceleration lane.
• Use turn signal.
• Avoid stopping in the exit lane.
• Slow to the speed of entry and exit lanes.
• When the exit is located on the left of a roadway, look for signs that will direct traffic to the proper lane for exiting.
• If you miss an exit, go on to the next one.
• Never back up on an exit ramp or deceleration lane.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
离开高速公路、公园大道和收费公路  

在大多数情况下，高速公路出口处的匝道或减速车道（即位于高速公路出口处的额外车道）通常位于道路的右侧。驾驶员应始终留意指示标志，以确定应从何处驶离道路。如果驾驶员在高速公路上、公园大道或收费公路上错过了出口匝道，应继续前往下一个出口。

在离开高速公路、公园大道或收费公路时，请牢记以下几点：  
• 进入减速车道时开始减速。  
• 遵守减速车道上标明的建议速度限制。  
• 使用转向灯。  
• 避免在出口车道内停车。  
• 将车速降低至入口和出口车道的速度。  
• 如果出口位于道路左侧，请留意指示标志，以确定驶离所需的正确车道。  
• 如果错过了出口，请继续前往下一个出口。  
• 从不倒车离开匝道或减速车道。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Special Highway, Parkway, and Turnpike Conditions
WEAVE LANE
A weave lane is both an entrance and an exit for an expressway. Traffic may come onto and leave the expressway at the same location. This traffic weave causes conflicts, both for motorists using a weave lane and those on the expressway and entrance ramp (in terms of speed and space adjustments). The motorist entering from the entrance ramp must yield the right-of-way to the motorist leaving the expressway.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
特殊高速公路、公园大道和收费公路条件  
交织车道  
交织车道既是高速公路的入口，也是出口。交通可以在同一地点进入和离开高速公路。这种交通交织会造成冲突，既对使用交织车道的驾驶员，也对在高速公路上及入口匝道上的驾驶员（在速度和空间调整方面）产生影响。从入口匝道进入的驾驶员必须让行于离开高速公路的驾驶员。

rule 1

rule 2
IF location = 交织车道
THEN condition = 既是高速公路入口 AND condition = 也是高速公路出口

rule 3
IF location = 交织车道
THEN event = 交通在同一地点进入和离开高速公路 AND event = 产生交通交织冲突

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
HIGHWAYS THROUGH CITIES
The volume of traffic may increase dramatically. Speeds may slow to a crawl. The motorist should drive in the left or center lane to avoid merge conflicts during rush hour. A motorist should search for exits early and adjust position for exit.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
城市高速公路  
交通流量可能会急剧增加，车速可能会减缓至几乎停滞。在高峰时段，驾驶员应行驶在左侧或中间车道，以避免汇入车道时发生冲突。驾驶员应提前寻找出口，并调整车辆位置以便顺利驶出。

THEN direction = 左侧车道 OR direction = 中间车道 AND action = 避免汇入车道冲突

rule 2
IF location = 城市高速公路 AND event = 需要驶出 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 提前寻找出口 AND action = 调整车辆位置 AND target = 出口车道 AND outcome = 顺利驶出

rule:
DISABLED VEHICLES
When seeing a disabled vehicle ahead, a motorist should reduce speed and increase the space between his/her vehicle and the disabled vehicle. This may involve changing lanes. Be alert for pedestrians, tow trucks, and/or police vehicles. (See New Jersey’s “Move Over” law later in this chapter.)
If a motorist’s vehicle becomes disabled, he/she must:
• Pull off as far as possible onto the shoulder or median.
• Turn on emergency flashers.
• Raise the hood to signal for assistance.
• Stay in the vehicle, keep your seatbelt on and lock the doors.
• If available, use a cell phone to call for help.
• Ask anyone who stops to go to a phone and call for assistance.
• Do not get into a stranger’s vehicle.
rule_cn:
**故障车辆**

当驾驶员发现前方有故障车辆时，应减速并增加与故障车辆之间的安全距离。这可能需要变更车道。要留意行人、拖车和/或警车。（详见本章后面的新泽西州“让行”法。）

如果驾驶员的车辆发生故障，必须做到以下几点：

- 尽可能将车辆驶至路肩或中央隔离带。
- 开启危险报警闪光灯。
- 抬起引擎盖以示意需要帮助。
- 保持在车内，系好安全带并锁好车门。
- 如有手机，应使用手机拨打求救电话。
- 请任何停车的人员前往电话亭拨打求救电话。
- 不要进入陌生人的车辆。

rule 1

THEN action = 减速 AND action = 增加安全距离 AND target = 故障车辆

rule 2
IF event = 发现前方故障车辆 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 变更车道

rule 10
IF event = 自身车辆发生故障
THEN action = 不要进入 AND target = 陌生人车辆

rule:
CONSTRUCTION AREAS
A motorist should always stay alert for construction-area warning signs. When coming across these areas, a motorist should adjust speed and adjust position to maintain space around his/her vehicle.
rule_cn:
施工区域  
驾驶员应始终留意施工区域的警示标志。当经过这些区域时，驾驶员应调整车速并改变位置，以保持车辆周围有足够的空间。

rule:
TOLL BOOTHS
A motorist should stay alert for toll booth signs and begin reducing speed early, as traffic may be backed up at the booth. Green lights or signals highlight open booths. A motorist should be aware of EZ Pass booths and lanes, including high speed EZ Pass lanes. When exiting toll booths, a motorist should search traffic to both sides for merging potential, accelerate smoothly and adjust speed.
rule_cn:
过路费收费站  
驾驶员应留意收费站标志，并提前减速，因为车流可能在收费站处出现拥堵。绿色灯光或信号表示收费站开放。驾驶员应注意设有 EZ Pass 的收费站和车道，包括高速 EZ Pass 车道。在驶离收费站时，驾驶员应观察两侧车流，寻找可能的汇入机会，平稳加速并调整车速。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Curves
It is important for a motorist to adjust steering and speed when approaching a curve in the road. The best way to enter a curve is to slow down before entering and avoid drifting into another lane. A motorist should always watch for vehicles that may drift into his/her lane as well. Check for Curve Ahead warning signs and recommended speeds.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
弯道  
当车辆接近弯道时，驾驶员应调整转向和车速。进入弯道的最佳方式是在进入弯道前减速，并避免驶入其他车道。驾驶员应始终留意是否有车辆可能驶入自己的车道。注意前方弯道警示标志和建议的行驶速度。

THEN action = 留意是否有车辆可能驶入自己的车道

THEN action = 注意前方弯道警示标志 AND action = 注意建议的行驶速度

rule:
Interchanges
Divided roadways are built for express traffic. To ease traffic flow, there are usually no traffic lights or direct intersections. To enter or exit such an expressway, a cloverleaf turn is often necessary. A motorist should watch for entrance and exit signs and drive slowly in the circle, obeying the posted speed limit.
rule_cn:
匝道
分隔的道路专为快速通行而设计。为了缓解交通流量，通常没有交通信号灯或直接的交叉路口。要进入或离开这样的高速公路，通常需要进行苜蓿叶式转弯。驾驶员应注意入口和出口标志，在环形匝道内缓慢行驶，并遵守标示的限速规定。

rule 2
IF location = 环形匝道 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed = 缓慢

rule 3
IF location = 匝道 AND action = 行驶 AND condition = 标示限速规定
THEN action = 遵守标示的限速规定

rule:
Turning Regulations
RIGHT TURN ON RED
Unless a No Turn on Red sign is posted, New Jersey law authorizes a right turn on a red light after a motorist comes to a full stop and checks for traffic. A motorist must yield to all oncoming traffic and pedestrians before turning right at a red light. Difficult-to-see vehicles, such as bicycles and mopeds, may have a green light, so it is important for a motorist to be aware of their presence. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-115) Always use a proper turn signal at least 100 feet before making any turn and cancel the signal after completing the turn. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-126)
rule_cn:
右转规定  
右转红灯  
除非设有“禁止右转红灯”标志，新泽西州法律允许机动车在红灯时右转，但必须先完全停车并确认交通情况。机动车在红灯时右转前，必须让行所有对向车辆和行人。由于自行车和轻便摩托车等视线不佳的车辆可能享有绿灯，因此驾驶员应注意它们的存在。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-115）  
在任何转弯前至少100英尺处使用正确的转向灯，并在完成转弯后取消转向灯。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-126）

rule 1
IF location = 新泽西州 AND sign = 禁止右转红灯
THEN action != 右转 AND trafficlight = 红灯

rule 2

THEN action = 完全停车 AND action = 确认交通情况 AND action = 让行 AND target = 对向车辆 AND action = 让行 AND target = 行人 AND action = 注意 AND target = 自行车 OR 轻便摩托车

rule 3
IF action = 右转 OR action = 左转
THEN distance >= 100英尺 AND action = 使用 AND target = 正确转向灯

rule 4
IF event = 完成转弯
THEN action = 取消 AND target = 转向灯

rule:
RIGHT TURNS (N.J.S.A. 39:4-123)
To make a safe right turn, a motorist should approach the intersection as far to the right as possible, keeping near to the curb or parked vehicles. The motorist should not swing outward or into another lane while making the right turn. He/she should drive up to the turn as far to the right as possible, keeping close to the right curb or parked vehicles at the curb. Proper vehicle positioning prior to a right turn reduces the chance of another vehicle being in the space on the right as the motorist makes the turn. He/she should not swing into the wrong lane while making the turn. Use turn signal; SLOW DOWN.
rule_cn:
右转（新泽西州法律第39:4-123条）

为了安全地进行右转，驾驶员应尽可能靠右接近交叉路口，尽量靠近路边或停放的车辆。在右转时，驾驶员不应向道路中央或另一车道偏离。他/她应尽可能靠右行驶至转弯处，始终保持靠近右侧路边或停放的车辆。在右转前正确地调整车辆位置，可以减少在转弯过程中右侧空间有其他车辆的可能性。在转弯时，他/她不应进入错误的车道。使用转向灯；减速。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
LEFT TURNS (N.J.S.A. 39:4-123)
Left turns, two vehicles: When two vehicles meet at an intersection and both have signaled to turn left, extra caution must be applied. When safe, each motorist should turn to the left of the center of the intersection.
Left turn from a one-way road on to a one-way road: Approaching the turn in the left lane, the motorist should turn into the left lane of the road he/she is entering.
Left turn from a two-way road onto a two-way road: Approach the turn as close as possible to the line nearest to the center of the road. When turning, the vehicle should not cross lane markings. The motorist should keep to the right of the center line of the road that the vehicle is entering.
Left turns, between intersections: Between intersections, solid lines show when not to pass. However, these lines may be crossed with care when entering or leaving driveways in business or residential areas.
Left turn from a two-way road onto a four-lane highway: Approach the turn as close to the center line to the right side of the road as possible. Make the turn before reaching the center of the intersection. It is important not to cross lane markings. The motorist should turn into the lane nearest the center line of the right side of the other road. This is the passing lane of the four-lane highway. When traffic permits, the motorist should move to the right, out of the passing lane. Use turn signal; Yield to oncoming traffic; DO NOT CROSS DIVIDING LINE; Don’t cut corners.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
左转（新泽西州法律第39:4-123条）  

**两辆车左转：**  
当两辆车在交叉路口相遇，且双方都已示意左转时，应特别谨慎。在安全的情况下，每位驾驶员应将车辆左转至交叉路口中心线的左侧。  

**从单行道左转进入另一条单行道：**  
接近转弯时，应位于左侧车道，然后驶入进入道路的左侧车道。  

**从双向道路左转进入另一条双向道路：**  
应尽可能靠近道路中心线一侧的车道接近转弯处。转弯时，车辆不得越过车道标线。驾驶员应保持在进入道路的中心线右侧。  

**在交叉路口之间的左转：**  
交叉路口之间，实线表示禁止超车。但在商业或住宅区进入或驶出车道时，可谨慎越过这些标线。  

**从双向道路左转进入四车道高速公路：**  
应尽可能靠近道路右侧的中心线接近转弯处。在到达交叉路口中心之前完成转弯。注意不要越过车道标线。驾驶员应驶入另一条道路右侧中心线附近的车道，这是四车道高速公路的超车道。当交通允许时，驾驶员应向右移动，驶出超车道。使用转向灯；让行对向车辆；**不得越过分隔线**；**不要抢道转弯**。

rule 1
IF action = 左转 AND event = 两辆车在交叉路口相遇 AND condition = 双方都已示意左转 AND action = 行驶
THEN direction = 交叉路口中心线的左侧 AND condition = 安全的情况下 AND condition = 特别谨慎

rule 2
IF action = 左转 AND location = 从单行道进入另一条单行道 AND event = 接近转弯
THEN location = 左侧车道 AND target = 进入道路的左侧车道

rule 3

THEN location = 尽可能靠近道路中心线一侧的车道 AND action = 转弯时不得越过车道标线 AND direction = 保持在进入道路的中心线右侧

rule 4
IF action = 左转 AND location = 交叉路口之间 AND condition = 商业或住宅区 AND event = 进入或驶出车道
THEN action = 可谨慎越过实线标线

rule 5
IF action = 左转 AND location = 交叉路口之间 AND condition = 实线标线
THEN action = 禁止超车

rule 6
IF action = 左转 AND location = 从双向道路进入四车道高速公路 AND event = 接近转弯处
THEN location = 尽可能靠近道路右侧的中心线

rule 7
IF action = 左转 AND location = 从双向道路进入四车道高速公路 AND event = 完成转弯
THEN condition = 在到达交叉路口中心之前 AND action = 不得越过车道标线 AND target = 另一条道路右侧中心线附近的车道 AND condition = 四车道高速公路的超车道

rule 8

THEN action = 向右移动 AND target = 驶出超车道

rule 9
IF action = 左转 AND location = 从双向道路进入四车道高速公路
THEN action = 使用转向灯 AND action = 让行对向车辆 AND action = 不得越过分隔线 AND action = 不要抢道转弯

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Stopping Regulations
Signs, signals, and traffic rules indicate when a motorist must stop. A motorist must be careful when traveling through an intersection and exercise caution when proceeding from a red light after the light turns green. There may be other vehicles coming through or still in the intersection.
Most crashes at traffic signals happen in the first few seconds after the light has changed. When a yellow light follows a green light, a motorist must stop before entering the intersection, unless yellow appears when the vehicle is too close to stop safely. If the light changes while a driver is already in the intersection, he/she should go through with caution. Be alert for a stale green light; this is a light that has been green for some time. Be prepared for it to change to yellow and then to red. Slow down and stop accordingly.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
停车规定  
标志、信号和交通规则指示机动车何时必须停车。在通过路口时，驾驶员必须格外小心，并在红灯转为绿灯后谨慎起步。此时可能会有其他车辆正通过路口或仍在路口内。  

大多数在交通信号灯处的事故发生在信号灯改变后的前几秒钟。当绿灯变为黄灯时，驾驶员必须在进入路口前停车，除非车辆距离路口太近，无法安全停车。如果驾驶员已经进入路口，而信号灯发生变化，应谨慎通过。要注意“滞留绿灯”现象，即信号灯已持续为绿色一段时间。要准备好应对它变为黄灯，然后变为红灯的情况，适时减速并停车。
trl:
rule 1
IF event = 遇到停车标志 OR event = 遇到红灯 OR event = 交通规则指示停车 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 必须停车

rule 2
IF event = 红灯转为绿灯 AND action = 起步
THEN action = 谨慎起步 AND condition = 格外小心

rule 3
IF event = 绿灯变为黄灯 AND action = 接近路口 AND distance = 距离路口太近 AND condition = 无法安全停车
THEN action = 继续通过路口

rule 4
IF event = 绿灯变为黄灯 AND action = 接近路口 AND condition = 能够安全停车
THEN action = 在进入路口前停车

rule 5
IF action = 已进入路口 AND event = 信号灯发生变化
THEN action = 谨慎通过路口

rule 6
IF condition = 滞留绿灯 AND event = 信号灯已持续绿色一段时间 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 适时减速 AND action = 准备停车

rule:
A motorist must stop:
• At an intersection with a stop sign.
• At an intersection with a red light either flashing or illuminated.
• At an intersection with a yellow light after a green light, unless too close to stop safely.
• When a traffic officer orders the vehicle to stop.
• When there is a yield sign and traffic does not permit a safe merge.
• When a school bus is picking up or letting off children and/or the red lights are flashing.
• When coming from an alley, private driveway, or building.
• At a bridge span that is about to open for boat traffic.
• For a blind pedestrian using a white or metallic walking cane, or a trained guide dog, or a guide dog instructor engaged in instructing a guide dog.
• For a pedestrian in a crosswalk or at an intersection.
• For a motorized wheelchair or mobility-assistance device in a crosswalk or at an intersection.
Single white lines show motorists where to stop at stop signs or traffic signals.
rule_cn:
驾驶员必须停车：
• 在设有停车标志的交叉路口。
• 在红灯闪烁或亮起的交叉路口。
• 在绿灯后变为黄灯的交叉路口，除非距离太近无法安全停车。
• 当交通警察命令车辆停车时。
• 当设有让行标志且交通状况不允许安全汇入时。
• 当校车正在上下学生，或校车的红灯正在闪烁时。
• 从小巷、私人车道或建筑物驶出时。
• 在即将为船只交通开启的桥梁上。
• 为使用白色或金属色步行手杖的盲人行人，或为正在训练导盲犬的导盲犬训练员。
• 为正在人行横道或交叉路口的行人。
• 为正在人行横道或交叉路口的电动轮椅或助行设备使用者。
单白线指示驾驶员在停车标志或交通信号处停车的位置。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
STOP AT RAILROAD CROSSINGS
To ensure public safety, the New Jersey Department of Transportation (NJDOT) and railroads mark public highway rail-grade crossings, also known as railroad crossings with one or more warning devices. Warning devices include advance-warning signs, pavement markings in front of a railroad crossing’s flashing red lights (usually on railroad crossing signs), gates or gates with flashing red lights, ringing bells, and flag signals.
A motorist must stop at least 15 feet from a railroad crossing when there are flashing red lights, ringing bells, descending or lowered gates, or flag signals. Flashing red lights, ringing bells, descending gates or gates that have already been lowered indicate that a train is coming, and a motorist must stop. A motorist should never cross until the gates have been raised, the bells have stopped ringing and the red lights have stopped flashing. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-127.1) Never race a train. A motorist can underestimate the speed and distance of trains. Most trains need more than a mile to stop if traveling at 60 mph or more.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
在铁路道口停车  
为确保公众安全，新泽西州交通部（NJDOT）和铁路公司会标记公共公路的铁路平交道口，这些道口也被称为设有警告装置的铁路道口。警告装置包括提前警示标志、铁路道口闪烁红灯前的路面标记（通常位于铁路道口标志上）、闸门或带有闪烁红灯的闸门、响铃以及信号旗。  

当铁路道口出现闪烁红灯、响铃、下落或已降下的闸门，或信号旗时，驾驶员必须在距离铁路道口至少15英尺（约4.5米）处停车。闪烁红灯、响铃、下落的闸门或已降下的闸门表明有火车即将通过，驾驶员必须停车。驾驶员在闸门升起、响铃停止、红灯停止闪烁之前，不得穿越铁路道口。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-127.1）不要与火车赛跑。驾驶员往往低估火车的速度和距离。大多数火车如果以每小时60英里或更高的速度行驶，需要超过一英里（约1.6公里）的距离才能停下。

THEN action = 停车 AND distance >= 15英尺 AND target = 铁路道口

rule 2
IF event = 铁路道口闪烁红灯 OR event = 响铃 OR event = 闸门下落 OR event = 闸门已降下 AND condition = 表明有火车即将通过
THEN action = 必须停车 AND target = 铁路道口

rule 3
IF event = 闸门未升起 OR event = 响铃未停止 OR event = 红灯未停止闪烁
THEN action = 不得穿越 AND target = 铁路道口

rule 4

THEN action = 允许穿越 AND target = 铁路道口

rule 5
IF target = 火车 AND action = 与火车赛跑
THEN action = 禁止

rule:
Special Circumstances:
Some vehicles, such as school buses, buses, or vehicles carrying hazardous materials must always stop at railroad crossings. When driving behind one of these vehicles, a motorist must be prepared to stop, even if the signals do not indicate a train is coming. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-128)
A motorist should never stop his/her vehicle on railroad tracks. When crossings railroad tracks, a motorist should make sure there is room on the other side to get completely across. If warning devices activate while a motorist is crossing railroad tracks, he/she should immediately proceed to the other side.
rule_cn:
特殊情况：
某些车辆，如校车、公交车或运输危险品的车辆，必须始终在铁路道口停车。当在这些车辆后面行驶时，驾驶员必须做好停车准备，即使信号灯并未显示有火车接近。（新泽西州法律第39:4-128条）

驾驶员绝不能在铁轨上停车。通过铁路道口时，驾驶员应确保另一侧有足够的空间，以便完全通过。如果在穿越铁轨时，警示装置被激活，驾驶员应立即驶向另一侧。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
STOP FOR SCHOOL BUSES (N.J.S.A. 39:4-128.1)
A motorist must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights. State law requires a motorist to stop at least 25 feet away if he/she is traveling on a two-lane road or on a multi-lane highway where lanes are only separated by lines, or on a privately maintained road. When traveling on a dual-lane highway, a motorist should slow to 10 mph if on the other side of a safety island or raised median. School buses are equipped with yellow (or amber) and red flashing lights. The yellow (or amber) lights go on before the bus stops and the red lights go on when the bus has stopped. However, a motorist should not depend on these lights, if driving behind a school bus. They could be malfunctioning.
When a school bus stops, all motorists traveling behind or approaching the bus must stop their vehicles at least 25 feet away. A motorist should only proceed after the bus signals have been turned off and even then, he/she must watch for children or persons who have developmental disabilities.
If a school bus has stopped directly in front of a school to pick up or let off children or persons with developmental disabilities, a motorist may pass from either direction at a speed of no more than 10 mph. Cars must stop 25 feet from school buses.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
停让校车（新泽西州法律第39:4-128.1条）  
机动车驾驶员在遇到校车开启红色闪烁灯时，必须停车。根据州法律，如果驾驶员在双车道道路、车道仅由标线分隔的多车道公路或私人维护道路上行驶，必须在距离校车至少25英尺（约7.6米）处停车。如果在双车道公路行驶，且位于安全岛或隔离带的另一侧，驾驶员应将车速降至每小时10英里（约16公里）。校车配备有黄色（或琥珀色）和红色闪烁灯。黄色（或琥珀色）灯在车辆停止前开启，红色灯在车辆停止时开启。然而，如果驾驶员在行驶过程中跟随校车，不应仅依赖这些灯光，因为它们可能有故障。  

当校车停止时，所有在后方或接近校车的驾驶员必须在距离校车至少25英尺（约7.6米）处停车。驾驶员只有在确认校车信号灯已关闭后才能继续行驶，即使如此，也必须留意是否有儿童或有发展障碍的人。  

如果校车在学校的前面停下，以接送儿童或有发展障碍的人，驾驶员可以从任一方向以不超过每小时10英里的速度通过。车辆必须在距离校车至少25英尺（约7.6米）处停车。

rule 1
IF event = 遇到校车 AND condition = 校车开启红色闪烁灯 AND location = 双车道道路 OR location = 多车道公路 AND condition = 车道仅由标线分隔 OR location = 私人维护道路 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 停车 AND distance >= 25英尺

rule 2
IF event = 遇到校车 AND condition = 校车开启红色闪烁灯 AND location = 双车道公路 AND condition = 位于安全岛或隔离带另一侧 AND action = 行驶
THEN speed <= 10 mph

rule 3

THEN speed <= 10 mph AND distance >= 25英尺

rule 6
IF event = 跟随校车 AND action = 行驶
THEN condition = 不应仅依赖黄色或红色闪烁灯

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
STOP FOR FROZEN DESSERT TRUCKS (N.J.S.A. 39:4-128.4)
When approaching or overtaking an ice cream or frozen dessert truck from either direction, and the truck is flashing red lights and posting a stop signal arm, a motorist must:
• Yield the right-of-way to any person who is crossing the roadway to or from the truck.
• Watch out for children and be prepared to stop.
• Stop, and then drive past the truck at a speed of no more than 15 mph.
• A motorist needs not stop on a dual highway if he/she is on the other side of a safety island or raised median.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
为冷冻甜品卡车让路（新泽西州法律第39:4-128.4条）  
当从任一方向接近或超越冰淇淋或冷冻甜品卡车时，如果卡车正在闪烁红灯并伸出停止信号杆，驾驶员必须：  
• 为正在横穿道路前往或离开卡车的任何人让行。  
• 注意儿童，并做好随时停车的准备。  
• 停车，然后以不超过15英里的时速驶过该卡车。  
• 如果驾驶员位于安全岛或抬高的分隔带的另一侧，且行驶在双车道高速公路上，则无需停车。

rule 1

THEN action = 为横穿道路前往或离开卡车的人让行

rule 2

THEN action != 停车

rule:
PULL OVER AND STOP FOR EMERGENCY VEHICLES
New Jersey law requires all motorists to yield to emergency vehicles when emergency vehicles sound sirens and/or flashing red and/or blue emergency lights. A motorist should steer to the extreme right of the roadway, stop, and wait for the emergency vehicle to pass. Afterward, the motorist should keep at least 300 feet behind a signaling emergency vehicle. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-92)
Police cars, fire trucks, ambulances or other emergency vehicles have sirens and red lights. Private vehicles operated by volunteer fire and rescue squad members (with emergency vehicle identification) responding to an emergency call use blue lights. A motorist should never park within 200 feet of a fire department vehicle in service or drive over a fire hose unless directed to do so by a fire, emergency rescue or police official.
rule_cn:
让路并为紧急车辆停车  
根据新泽西州法律，所有驾驶员在紧急车辆鸣笛和/或闪烁红灯和/或蓝灯时，都必须让行。驾驶员应将车辆驶至道路最右侧，停车并等待紧急车辆通过。之后，驾驶员应至少保持300英尺的距离，远离正在发出信号的紧急车辆。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-92）  

警车、消防车、救护车或其他紧急车辆配备有警报器和红灯。由志愿消防和救援队成员驾驶的私人车辆（配有紧急车辆标识）在响应紧急呼叫时使用蓝灯。驾驶员不得在消防车正在作业时在距离消防车200英尺范围内停车，除非得到消防、紧急救援或警察官员的指示，也不得驶过消防水带。

rule 1

THEN action = 让行

rule 2
IF event = 紧急车辆鸣笛 OR event = 闪烁红灯 OR event = 闪烁蓝灯 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 驶至道路最右侧 AND action = 停车 AND action = 等待紧急车辆通过

rule 3

THEN distance >= 300英尺 AND target = 正在发出信号的紧急车辆

rule 4
IF vehicleType = 警车 OR vehicleType = 消防车 OR vehicleType = 救护车 OR vehicleType = 其他紧急车辆 AND event = 使用警报器 OR event = 使用红灯 OR event = 使用蓝灯
THEN condition = 允许鸣笛或闪烁红蓝灯

rule 5
IF vehicleType = 私人车辆 AND credential = 志愿消防和救援队成员 AND credential = 紧急车辆标识 AND event = 响应紧急呼叫
THEN condition = 允许使用蓝灯

rule 6
IF event = 消防车正在作业 AND action = 停车
THEN distance >= 200英尺 AND target = 消防车

rule 7
IF event = 消防车正在作业 AND credential != 消防官员指示 AND credential != 紧急救援官员指示 AND credential != 警察官员指示 AND action = 停车
THEN distance >= 200英尺 AND target = 消防车

rule 8
IF event = 消防车正在作业
THEN action != 驶过消防水带

rule:
MOVE OVER LAW
New Jersey’s “Move Over” law requires all motorists approaching a stationary, authorized emergency vehicle, tow truck, highway maintenance, other emergency service vehicle that is displaying a flashing, blinking or alternating red, blue, amber or yellow light, or a configuration of lights containing one of these colors, or a disabled vehicle that is flashing hazard warning signal lights or utilizing road flares or reflective triangles, to change lanes, safety and traffic conditions permitting, into a lane not adjacent to the stationary emergency or disabled vehicle. If a lane change is impossible, prohibited by law or unsafe, the motorist must reduce the speed of his/her vehicle to a reasonable and proper speed that is lower than the posted speed limit and be prepared to stop, if necessary. Motorists who violate this law face a fine of not less than $100 and not more than $500. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-92.2) Additionally, motorists convicted of three or more offenses may be subject to motor vehicle penalty points. (N.J.S.A. 39:5-30.5)
rule_cn:
“让行”法

新泽西州的“让行”法规定，所有驾驶员在接近一辆静止的、具有合法资质的应急车辆（如救护车、拖车、公路养护车或其他应急服务车辆）时，如果该车辆正在使用闪烁、闪烁或交替的红、蓝、琥珀或黄色灯光，或者使用包含这些颜色之一的灯光组合，或者是一辆正在使用危险警告信号灯、路障或反光三角形的故障车辆，驾驶员应在确保安全和交通条件允许的情况下，驶入与该静止应急或故障车辆不相邻的车道。如果无法变道，或者变道被法律禁止或不安全，驾驶员必须将车速降低至低于限速标志所标明的合理且适当的速度，并随时准备停车。违反此法律的驾驶员将面临不少于100美元、不超过500美元的罚款。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-92.2）此外，被认定三次或以上违反该法律的驾驶员可能还会被处以机动车违规记分。（N.J.S.A. 39:5-30.5）
trl:
rule 1
IF event = 接近静止应急车辆 AND vehicleType = 合法资质应急车辆 AND condition = 使用闪烁红灯光 OR 使用闪烁蓝灯光 OR 使用闪烁琥珀灯光 OR 使用闪烁黄色灯光 OR 使用交替红蓝琥珀黄色灯光 OR 使用包含红蓝琥珀黄色之一灯光组合 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 驶入不相邻车道 AND condition = 确保安全 AND condition = 交通条件允许

rule 2
IF event = 接近静止故障车辆 AND condition = 使用危险警告信号灯 OR condition = 使用路障 OR condition = 使用反光三角形 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 驶入不相邻车道 AND condition = 确保安全 AND condition = 交通条件允许

rule 3
IF event = 接近静止应急车辆 AND vehicleType = 合法资质应急车辆 AND condition = 使用闪烁红灯光 OR 使用闪烁蓝灯光 OR 使用闪烁琥珀灯光 OR 使用闪烁黄色灯光 OR 使用交替红蓝琥珀黄色灯光 OR 使用包含红蓝琥珀黄色之一灯光组合 AND condition = 无法变道 OR condition = 变道被法律禁止 OR condition = 变道不安全 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 降低车速 AND speed < 限速标志标明速度 AND condition = 合理且适当 AND action = 随时准备停车

rule 4
IF event = 接近静止故障车辆 AND condition = 使用危险警告信号灯 OR condition = 使用路障 OR condition = 使用反光三角形 AND condition = 无法变道 OR condition = 变道被法律禁止 OR condition = 变道不安全 AND action = 行驶
THEN action = 降低车速 AND speed < 限速标志标明速度 AND condition = 合理且适当 AND action = 随时准备停车

rule 5
IF event = 违反让行法
THEN outcome = 罚款 AND amount >= 100美元 AND amount <= 500美元

rule 6
IF event = 被认定违反让行法 AND amount >= 3次
THEN outcome = 机动车违规记分

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
MESSAGE FROM THE ATTORNEY GENERAL
For many people, being pulled over by a Police Officer while driving a vehicle can be a stressful event. In order to make the traffic stop as safe and pleasant as possible for all involved, here are some important tips:
• Pull over in a safe place as soon as possible.
• Be courteous, mutual respect between the officer and the driver is expected and encouraged.
• Have your license, insurance card and registration in a place you can easily access.
• Turn down your music.
• If you are stopped at night, turn on your dome and/or interior lights. This will increase the visibility inside your vehicle so the Officer will be less concerned about what he or she cannot see.
• Roll down your window.
• Keep your hands visible, preferably on the steering wheel.
• Do not make sudden movements, particularly if the movements involve reaching into areas not visible to the Officer. If you must reach for something, wait for the Officer to come to your vehicle and tell the Officer what you are planning to do before you do it.
• Stay calm and communicate with the Officer.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
司法部长致词  
对于许多人来说，驾驶车辆时被警察拦下可能会是一件令人紧张的事情。为了使交通拦检过程对所有相关人员都更加安全和愉快，这里有一些重要的提示：  
• 尽快将车辆停靠在安全的地方。  
• 保持礼貌，警察与驾驶员之间应互相尊重，并且这种尊重是被鼓励的。  
• 将驾驶证、保险卡和车辆登记证放在便于取用的地方。  
• 关掉音乐。  
• 如果是在夜间被拦下，请打开车顶灯和/或车内灯。这将提高车内可见度，使警察对无法看到的部分感到更放心。  
• 打开车窗。  
• 保持双手可见，最好是放在方向盘上。  
• 不要做出突然的动作，尤其是涉及伸手到警察看不到的区域时。如果必须拿取物品，请等待警察来到您的车辆，并在行动前告知警察您打算做什么。  
• 保持冷静并与警察进行沟通。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Using Headlights
Proper use of headlights is critical to safe driving. Headlights must be used between one-half hour after sunset and one-half hour before sunrise. Headlights must also be used when visibility is 500 feet or less, when using windshield wipers (during rain, snow, and ice) or when encountering fog, mist, smoke, or other factors that reduce visibility. (N.J.S.A. 39:3-46)
Being able to see clearly while driving is especially important. A vehicle’s lights should always be in good working order and clean. Headlights help other motorists see approaching vehicles. Parking or auxiliary lights cannot legally be used in place of headlights when headlights are required.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
使用车灯  
正确使用车灯对于安全驾驶至关重要。在日落后半小时至日出前半小时期间，必须使用车灯。在能见度低于500英尺、使用雨刷器（雨天、雪天和结冰时）或遇到雾气、霾、烟雾或其他降低能见度因素时，也必须使用车灯。（新泽西州法律第39:3-46条）  

在驾驶时能够清晰地看到前方尤为重要。车辆的灯光应始终保持良好工作状态并保持清洁。车灯有助于其他驾驶员识别接近的车辆。在需要使用车灯时，不得使用停车灯或辅助灯作为替代。

THEN action = 使用车灯

rule 2

THEN action = 使用车灯

rule 3

rule 4

THEN action = 使用车灯

rule 5
IF event = 需要使用车灯 AND action = 驾驶
THEN action != 使用停车灯作为替代 AND action != 使用辅助灯作为替代

rule 6
IF action = 驾驶
THEN condition = 车灯良好工作状态 AND condition = 车灯保持清洁

rule:
BRIGHT AND DIM
Headlights have two sets of beams: bright (high) and dim (low), which are controlled by a switch or button on or near the dashboard. The bright beam is for open country driving when there is no traffic in sight. The bright beam helps a motorist see farther ahead and peripherally or at a wider angle. At night, a motorist’s pupils are dilated, allowing more light to aid in the ability to see. Bright beams can momentarily blind other motorists by constricting the pupils and should not be used if other vehicles are approaching or when driving behind another vehicle. It can take three to five seconds for a motorist to recover from the glare of approaching high-beam headlights. At a speed of 50 mph, a motorist will have traveled the length of a football field while being unable to see. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, a motorist should look to the right of the road until the vehicle passes. Never flash high beams at an approaching motorist.
The dim beams are used for city driving and driving in traffic on roadways. Dim beams are focused down on the road. Dim beams are used when traveling behind other vehicles or when another vehicle is approaching.
rule_cn:
明亮与暗淡灯光  
车灯有两种光束：明亮（远光）和暗淡（近光），它们由仪表盘上或附近的开关或按钮控制。明亮灯光适用于没有车辆接近的开阔道路上行驶。明亮灯光能让驾驶员看得更远，同时也能更宽广地观察周围环境。夜间，驾驶员的瞳孔会放大，从而让更多的光线进入眼睛，有助于提高视力。然而，明亮灯光可能会使其他驾驶员的瞳孔收缩，导致暂时失明，因此在有其他车辆接近或在跟随其他车辆行驶时，不应使用远光灯。驾驶员从迎面而来的远光灯眩光中恢复视力需要三到五秒的时间。以每小时50英里的速度行驶时，驾驶员在无法看清的情况下，会行驶大约一个足球场的长度。如果迎面而来的车辆使用了远光灯，驾驶员应将视线移向道路右侧，直到该车辆驶过。切勿向迎面而来的驾驶员闪烁远光灯。  

暗淡灯光用于城市道路行驶和有交通的道路上行驶。暗淡灯光的光束集中在道路上。当驾驶员在其他车辆后面行驶，或有其他车辆接近时，应使用暗淡灯光。

THEN action = 切勿闪烁远光灯

rule 5

THEN action = 可以使用明亮灯光

rule 6

THEN action = 使用暗淡灯光

rule 7

rule:
OTHER TYPES OF LIGHTS
• Parking lights: Parking lights are to be used for a short period of time, such as when a vehicle is left in a permitted zone, to show other motorists where a vehicle is parked. Parking lights are required on vehicles parked in areas other than business or residential zones.
• Taillights: Taillights turn on at the same time as a vehicle’s headlights and parking lights. They become brighter when a motorist applies the brakes to show that he/she is slowing or stopping. During the day, without headlights, the taillights also turn on as a motorist applies the brakes.
• Brake lights: Brake lights become brighter when a motorist applies the brakes, showing that the vehicle is slowing or stopping.
• Interim (overhead) lights: Found inside the vehicle, these types of lights should be used only briefly (when necessary) when driving or to comply with a police officer’s request to illuminate the motorist’s compartment of the vehicle when stopped.
• Dashboard lights: If dashboard lights are too bright, they may create a glare for the motorist and impede vision. The lights should be kept dim but still light enough for a motorist to read the dials.
• Spotlights: Spotlights should be used only in emergencies. This also applies to emergency flashers (hazard lights). Spotlights may not be used for driving purposes.
• Fog lights: These auxiliary driving lights may be used with low-beam headlights to provide general lighting ahead of a motor vehicle, specifically during foggy weather conditions. (N.J.A.C. 13:20-32.25)
rule_cn:
其他类型的灯光  
• 示廓灯：示廓灯用于短时间使用，例如当车辆停放在允许停放的区域时，以向其他驾驶员表明车辆的停放位置。在商业区或住宅区以外的区域停放的车辆必须配备示廓灯。  
• 尾灯：尾灯与车辆的前大灯和示廓灯同时开启。当驾驶员踩下刹车踏板时，尾灯会变得更亮，以表示车辆正在减速或停车。白天且未开启前大灯时，尾灯也会在驾驶员踩下刹车踏板时自动开启。  
• 刹车灯：当驾驶员踩下刹车踏板时，刹车灯会变得更亮，以表示车辆正在减速或停车。  
• 临时（顶灯）：这些灯位于车内，仅在驾驶时短暂使用（如必要时），或在停车时遵从交警要求，用于照亮驾驶员的驾驶舱。  
• 仪表盘灯：如果仪表盘灯太亮，可能会使驾驶员产生眩光，影响视线。仪表盘灯应调至较暗但又足够明亮，以便驾驶员能够看清仪表盘上的指针。  
• 强光灯：强光灯仅在紧急情况下使用。这也适用于紧急闪光灯（危险警告灯）。强光灯不得用于正常驾驶。  
• 雾灯：雾灯是辅助照明灯，可与近光灯配合使用，以在雾天等特殊天气条件下为车辆前方提供一般照明。（N.J.A.C. 13:20-32.25）
trl:
rule 1
IF action = 停放 AND location != 商业区 AND location != 住宅区
THEN action = 配备示廓灯

rule 2

THEN action = 使用示廓灯 AND condition = 短时间使用

rule 3

rule 4

THEN action = 变亮 AND target = 尾灯 AND outcome = 表示减速或停车

rule 5

THEN action = 自动开启 AND target = 尾灯

THEN action = 变亮 AND target = 刹车灯 AND outcome = 表示减速或停车

rule 7

THEN condition = 较暗但足够明亮 AND outcome = 看清仪表盘指针 AND outcome = 不产生眩光

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Parking Regulations
A motorist should always check for traffic when leaving a vehicle after parking. He/she should also check for bicycles or mopeds, which are sometimes difficult to see, before opening the driver-side door and exiting the vehicle. A motorist opening a door into traffic may be liable for any crash with a moving vehicle. It is safer for passengers to exit a parked vehicle from the curbside. A motorist should read parking signs before parking on a city street to be aware of restrictions or time limits. It is illegal for a vehicle to be parked more than six inches from the curb. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-135) Never park where a vehicle will block traffic.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
停车规定  
车辆停放后，驾驶员应始终检查交通情况再离开车辆。在打开驾驶侧车门并下车前，还应检查是否有自行车或轻便摩托车，因为这些车辆有时较难察觉。如果驾驶员向车流方向开车门，可能会对与行驶中的车辆发生碰撞负有责任。乘客应从路边下车，以确保更安全。驾驶员在城市街道停车前应阅读停车标志，以了解相关限制或时间规定。车辆停放距离路边不得超过六英寸（N.J.S.A. 39:4-135）。不得在车辆会阻碍交通的地方停放。

THEN action = 检查 AND target = 自行车 OR target = 轻便摩托车

IF action = 向车流方向打开 AND target = 车门
THEN outcome = 负有责任 AND event = 与行驶中的车辆发生碰撞

THEN direction = 路边

THEN distance <= 6英寸 AND target = 路边

rule 7
IF action = 停放 AND condition = 车辆会阻碍交通
THEN action = 不得停放

rule:
DO NOT PARK (N.J.S.A. 39:4-138)
Unless directed to do so by a police officer or to avoid a crash, a motorist should never stop or park at any of the following places:
• In a crosswalk.
• Between a safety zone for pedestrians and the adjacent curb or within 20 feet of the end of the safety zone.
• Near properly marked street construction.
• In a space on public or private property marked for vehicle parking for persons with a disability (unless legally authorized).
• On an interstate highway.
• In a sidewalk.
• In a bus stop zone.
• In front of a public or private driveway.
• Within an intersection.
• Within 10 feet of a fire hydrant.
• Within 25 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection or sideline of a street or intersection highway, except at alleys.
• Within 50 feet of a railroad crossing.
• Within 50 feet of a stop sign.
• Within 20 feet of the driveway entrance to any fire station and within 75 feet on the street opposite a fire station entrance.
• On any bridge or elevated roadway or in any tunnel.
• Next to another vehicle parked at the curb (double parking).
• In an area where parking is prohibited by municipal ordinance.
In case of mechanical trouble or other emergency, a motorist should stop on the right highway shoulder and turn on emergency flashers.
rule_cn:
禁止停车（新泽西州法律第39:4-138条）  
除非有警察指示或为了避免事故，驾驶员不得在以下任何地点停车或停车：  
• 在人行横道上。  
• 在行人安全区与相邻人行道之间，或在行人安全区尽头20英尺范围内。  
• 在设有明确标志的施工路段附近。  
• 在公共或私人财产上为残疾人专设的停车空间内（除非依法授权）。  
• 在州际高速公路上。  
• 在人行道上。  
• 在公交车站区域内。  
• 在公共或私人车道入口前。  
• 在交叉路口内。  
• 在消防栓10英尺范围内。  
• 在交叉路口或街道或交叉路口公路的路边人行横道25英尺范围内（但不包括小巷）。  
• 在铁路道口50英尺范围内。  
• 在停止标志50英尺范围内。  
• 在任何消防站车道入口20英尺范围内，或在消防站入口对面街道75英尺范围内。  
• 在任何桥梁、高架道路或隧道内。  
• 在路边停放的其他车辆旁边（双排停车）。  
• 在市政规章禁止停车的区域。  

如遇车辆故障或其他紧急情况，驾驶员应将车辆停在道路右侧的应急车道，并打开紧急警示灯。

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Cellular Telephones
State law prohibits the use of handheld electronic devices (such as cellular telephone) while driving a motor vehicle on any public road or highway. Using a handheld cellular telephone or texting device is a primary offense. Law enforcement may stop and cite a motorist specifically for these actions. Motorists are permitted to use a hands-free cellular telephone if it does not interfere with any federally required safety equipment or with the safe operation of the vehicle. Although the use of a hands-free cellular telephone is legal, it is strongly discouraged.
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
手机使用  
根据州法律，驾驶机动车在任何公共道路或高速公路上时，禁止使用手持电子设备（如手机）。使用手持手机或发送短信属于主要违规行为。执法部门可以因这些行为单独拦截并处罚驾驶员。驾驶员如果使用免提手机且不会干扰任何联邦规定的安全设备或不影响车辆的正常安全操作，则是被允许的。虽然使用免提手机是合法的，但强烈不建议这样做。

THEN outcome = 允许

rule:
A handheld cellular telephone may be used only in certain emergency situations, which include:
• Fire
• Traffic crash
• Serious road hazard
• Medical emergency
• Hazardous material emergency
Motorists in the above-mentioned circumstances must keep one hand on the steering wheel while using a handheld telephone. To prove legal use of a handheld telephone while operating a motor vehicle, a motorist may be asked to produce testimony or written statements from appropriate authorities, or telephone records. The fine for breaking this law is $200-$400 for a first offense, $400-$600 for a second offense within 10 years of the first offense, $600-$800 for a third offense within 10 years of the second offense and for all subsequent offenses. A person convicted of a third or subsequent violation shall also be assessed three motor vehicle penalty points. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-97.3) There may be a 90-day license suspension as well.
rule_cn:
手持式移动电话仅在以下紧急情况下方可使用：
• 火灾
• 交通事故
• 严重道路危险
• 医疗紧急情况
• 危险品紧急情况

在上述情况下驾驶车辆的驾驶员在使用手持式移动电话时，必须保持一只手握在方向盘上。为了证明在驾驶机动车时合法使用手持式移动电话，驾驶员可能被要求出示相关执法部门的证词或书面声明，或电话记录。违反此规定的罚款如下：首次违规罚款为200至400美元，10年内再次违规的第二次罚款为400至600美元，10年内第三次违规的罚款为600至800美元，以及所有后续违规的罚款。对于第三次或之后的违规行为，还将被扣除三个机动车违规记分。（N.J.S.A. 39:4-97.3）此外，还可能面临长达90天的驾照暂扣。
trl:
rule 1
IF action = 使用手持式移动电话 AND event != 火灾 AND event != 交通事故 AND event != 严重道路危险 AND event != 医疗紧急情况 AND event != 危险品紧急情况 AND action = 驾驶车辆
THEN outcome = 违反规定

rule 2
IF action = 使用手持式移动电话 AND (event = 火灾 OR event = 交通事故 OR event = 严重道路危险 OR event = 医疗紧急情况 OR event = 危险品紧急情况) AND action = 驾驶车辆
THEN action = 保持一只手握在方向盘上

rule 3
IF outcome = 违反规定 AND condition = 首次违规
THEN amount = 200至400美元

rule 4
IF outcome = 违反规定 AND condition = 10年内第二次违规
THEN amount = 400至600美元

rule 5
IF outcome = 违反规定 AND condition = 10年内第三次违规
THEN amount = 600至800美元

rule 6
IF outcome = 违反规定 AND condition = 第三次或后续违规
THEN amount >= 600美元 AND outcome = 扣除三个机动车违规记分

rule 7
IF outcome = 违反规定 AND condition = 第三次或后续违规
THEN outcome = 可能面临长达90天的驾照暂扣

then 结果 = 违反规定

then 操作 = 保持一只手握在方向盘上

then 操作 = 保持一只手握在方向盘上

then 操作 = 保持一只手握在方向盘上

then 操作 = 保持一只手握在方向盘上
rule 7
if 结果 = 违反规定 and 条件 = 首次违规
then 金额 = 200至400美元
rule 8

then 结果 = 可能面临长达90天的驾照暂扣

rule: “Kulesh’s, Kuberts’ and Bolis’ Law,” enacted in 2012, establishes illegal use of a cellular telephone while driving as recklessness under the vehicular homicide (N.J.S.A. 2C:11-5) and assault by auto (N.J.S.A. 2C-12-1) statutes. The intent and effect of this law is to make it easier for prosecutors to obtain convictions for vehicular homicide or assault by auto against a person who illegally uses a cell phone while driving and, as result, kills or injures someone.
rule_cn: 2012年颁布的“库列什、库伯茨和博利斯法”规定，驾驶时非法使用手机属于车辆杀人（N.J.S.A. 2C:11-5）和以车施暴（N.J.S.A. 2C-12-1）罪中的鲁莽行为。该法律的立法意图和实际效果是，使检察官更容易对在驾驶过程中非法使用手机并导致他人死亡或受伤的人员提起车辆杀人或以车施暴的指控，从而获得有罪判决。
trl:
rule 1
IF action = 驾驶 AND event = 非法使用手机
THEN condition = 属于鲁莽行为

rule 2
IF action = 驾驶 AND event = 非法使用手机 AND event = 导致他人死亡
THEN outcome = 构成车辆杀人罪

rule 3
IF action = 驾驶 AND event = 非法使用手机 AND event = 导致他人受伤
THEN outcome = 构成以车施暴罪

rule 4
IF action = 驾驶 AND event = 非法使用手机 AND event = 导致他人死亡 OR event = 导致他人受伤
THEN outcome = 可提起车辆杀人指控 OR 可提起以车施暴指控
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 条件 = 属于鲁莽行为
rule 2
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 事件 = 导致他人死亡 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 结果 = 构成车辆杀人罪
rule 3
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 事件 = 导致他人受伤 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 结果 = 构成以车施暴罪
rule 4
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 事件 = 导致他人死亡 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 结果 = 可提起车辆杀人指控
rule 5
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 事件 = 导致他人受伤 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 结果 = 可提起车辆杀人指控
rule 6
if 事件 = 非法使用手机 and 事件 = 导致他人受伤 and 操作 = 驾驶
then 可提起以车施暴指控

rule: A graduated driver license (GDL) holder may not use a handheld or hands-free cellular telephone, or any other handheld electronic device, when behind the wheel. Doing so is a violation of GDL restrictions. (N.J.S.A. 39:3-13, 39:3-13.2a, 39:3-13.4)
rule_cn: 持有渐进式驾驶执照（GDL）的人在驾驶时不得使用手持式或免提式手机，或其他任何手持电子设备。这样做属于违反GDL的规定。（新泽西州法典第39:3-13条、第39:3-13.2a条、第39:3-13.4条）
trl:
rule 1
IF credential = 渐进式驾驶执照 AND action = 驾驶
THEN action != 使用 AND target = 手持式手机

rule 2
IF credential = 渐进式驾驶执照 AND action = 驾驶
THEN action != 使用 AND target = 免提式手机

rule 3
IF credential = 渐进式驾驶执照 AND action = 驾驶
THEN action != 使用 AND target = 任何手持电子设备

rule 4
IF credential = 渐进式驾驶执照 AND action = 驾驶 AND event = 使用手持式手机 OR event = 使用免提式手机 OR event = 使用任何手持电子设备
THEN outcome = 违反GDL规定
trl_postprocess:

if 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 操作 != 使用 and 操作对象 = 手持式手机
rule 2
if 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 操作 != 使用 and 操作对象 = 免提式手机
rule 3
if 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 操作 != 使用 and 操作对象 = 任何手持电子设备
rule 4
if 事件 = 使用手持式手机 and 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 结果 = 违反GDL规定
rule 5
if 事件 = 使用免提式手机 and 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 结果 = 违反GDL规定
rule 6
if 事件 = 使用任何手持电子设备 and 操作 = 驾驶 and 凭证 = 渐进式驾驶执照
then 结果 = 违反GDL规定

rule: A school bus driver may not use a handheld or hands-free cellular telephone while operating a school bus, except in an emergency or when the school bus is parked in a safe area off a highway. (N.J.S.A. 39:3B-25)
rule_cn: 校车司机在驾驶校车时，不得使用手持式或免提式手机，除非遇到紧急情况或校车停在高速公路外的安全区域。(新泽西州法律第39:3B-25条)

rule 3

THEN action = 允许使用手持式手机 OR action = 允许使用免提式手机

then 操作 = 允许使用免提式手机

rule:
SAFE DRIVING RULES AND REGULATIONS
Littering
Throwing trash, debris or rubbish from a moving or parked vehicle is illegal. Litter is a safety hazard and an eyesore. Fines of up to $1,000 may be imposed on motorists found throwing “dangerous objects” from a vehicle onto a roadway. If the vehicle is moving when litter is thrown, the motorist may lose his/her license. All trash, debris or rubbish carried in a vehicle must be covered to keep it from littering the roadway. (N.J.S.A. 39:4-63, 39:4-64)
rule_cn:
安全驾驶规则与规定  
乱扔垃圾  
从行驶中的车辆或停放的车辆上扔出垃圾、碎屑或废弃物是违法的。垃圾不仅构成安全隐患，也影响环境卫生。对于被发现从车辆上向道路上扔出“危险物品”的驾驶员，可能会被处以最高1000美元的罚款。如果在车辆行驶过程中扔出垃圾，驾驶员可能会被吊销驾照。车辆内所携带的所有垃圾、碎屑或废弃物都必须妥善覆盖，以防止污染道路。（新泽西州法律第39:4-63条、第39:4-64条）
trl:
rule 1
IF action = 扔出 AND target = 垃圾 OR target = 碎屑 OR target = 废弃物 AND event = 从车辆 AND condition = 车辆行驶中 OR 车辆停放
THEN outcome = 违法

rule 2
IF action = 扔出 AND target = 危险物品 AND event = 从车辆向道路 AND actor = 驾驶员
THEN amount <= 1000美元 AND outcome = 罚款

rule 3
IF action = 扔出 AND target = 垃圾 AND condition = 车辆行驶过程 AND actor = 驾驶员
THEN outcome = 吊销驾照

rule 4
IF target = 垃圾 OR target = 碎屑 OR target = 废弃物 AND location = 车辆内 AND event = 携带
THEN condition = 必须妥善覆盖 AND outcome = 防止污染道路
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 事件 = 从车辆 and 操作 = 扔出 and 条件 = 车辆行驶中 and 操作对象 = 垃圾
then 结果 = 违法
rule 2
if 事件 = 从车辆 and 操作 = 扔出 and 条件 = 车辆行驶中 and 操作对象 = 碎屑
then 结果 = 违法
rule 3
if 事件 = 从车辆 and 操作 = 扔出 and 条件 = 车辆行驶中 and 操作对象 = 废弃物
then 结果 = 违法
rule 4
if 事件 = 从车辆 and 操作 = 扔出 and 操作对象 = 废弃物 and 车辆停放
then 结果 = 违法
rule 5
if 操作主体 = 驾驶员 and 事件 = 从车辆向道路 and 操作 = 扔出 and 操作对象 = 危险物品
then 结果 = 罚款 and 金额 <= 1000美元
rule 6
if 操作主体 = 驾驶员 and 操作 = 扔出 and 条件 = 车辆行驶过程 and 操作对象 = 垃圾
then 结果 = 吊销驾照
rule 7
if 事件 = 携带 and 地点 = 车辆内 and 操作对象 = 垃圾
then 结果 = 防止污染道路 and 条件 = 必须妥善覆盖
rule 8
if 事件 = 携带 and 地点 = 车辆内 and 操作对象 = 碎屑
then 结果 = 防止污染道路 and 条件 = 必须妥善覆盖
rule 9
if 事件 = 携带 and 地点 = 车辆内 and 操作对象 = 废弃物
then 结果 = 防止污染道路 and 条件 = 必须妥善覆盖
